intro: Eleocharis lehmannii, commonly known as Lehmann's spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wetland or marshy environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. It is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to tolerate waterlogged soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
